intro: Ephedra multiflora, commonly known as the Chinese ephedra, is a shrub native to arid regions of China. It is characterized by its jointed stems and small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, which are typically pollinated by wind. Its stems contain ephedrine, a compound used in traditional medicine. Due to its medicinal properties, it is also classified as a controlled substance in many countries.
